Reviews.Title: “A cheap choice for a quick stop in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: EOAS
Reviews.Content: We were stopping by Berlin for the night in order to fly back to Greece and the next morning, so we needed something cheap and around the area (Kurfursterdamm). This was the cheapest, and decent-looking place we could find. It was a little bit worse than we expected but there were no big surprises. The Pension is situated in the first floor of an old, traditional building, having one of those old-style elevators; the rooms were quite spacious but not really cozy, since it was quite cold outside. The bathroom was quite clean and the tub was big. Of course there was no view, since the windows looked over the place where the whole building stores their garbage. Breakfast was acceptable. On the bad side, I should mention that they charge you 8 euros for parking, which is actually on the street and they take no responsibility for theft or anything else. Also, the receptionist could hardly speak English, so communication was a bit difficult. Other than that, the location is really good, since it is a really busy street with various stores, if you're up to some shopping, nice places to eat and two metro stations nearby. I hope I have helped in some way. :)

Reviews.Title: “Location great!”
Reviews.Author: ROSS009
Reviews.Content: Very close to K-dam, zoo and S-bahn line. We had reserved a single and a double room. The single was down a dingy stairway. The room had a shower tube open right into the main room! Our first double room had a bad mildew smell in the bathroom, but we never used it because after looking at the room, the key did not unlock it any more. We were switched to a dingy, large room at the back of the hotel. Lighting was very poor, and a slight mildew smell in the bathroom again. The next day we demanded room changes, and got two new rooms, which were okay. Breakfast quite good in a pleasant dining area. Room price is very good for Berlin, but beware what room you may end up in..

Reviews.Title: “Historical but cramped...”
Reviews.Author: Holidaymonger
Reviews.Content: Good location just off Kudamm. Apparently a very old historical building. Photos on their website are misleading. Rooms are small sized but adequate. Good breakfast spread everyday. I happily compromised luxury to be able to stay in a good location at a reasonable price and importantly with free wifi. Friendly staff and owner. All in all, recommended.....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location- calm and clean hotel-spacious room, best sleep ever”
Reviews.Author: SandrineW
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best location in town, you see the K-Furstendamm from the street and Zoo is in walking distance. The street has a supermarket, café and pub, and Hard Rock Café at the corner. The hotel is very small and calm (only 19 rooms) family-run and the staff is dedicated (but does not speak english). The room was very nice and spacious, nice bathroom with bathtub. Windows towards the quiet backyard. Cleaning and towels each day, showering supplies provided. Tv has 30 channels (2xBBC wich are the only ones not in German). The beds and pillows are supreme in comfort, best night sleep ever. The staff is very dedicated to this hotel, and helpful in a blunt manor. Breakfast is fresh and has eggs, panncakes, muesli, bread and ham/salami/cheese, mozzarella, yoghurt, seeds and fresh fruit, tea/coffee and orange- and tomatojuice. The breakfast room is small with maybe 10-12 tables and a balcony, nice and peaceful with no crowded areas. In all this hotel provides excellent value for a very modest price. The typical guest of this hotel seemed to be german, middle-aged and academic. This place is perfect for anybody who wants peace and quiet and to sleep well. For party teenagers, clubbers and hipsters this is the wrong choice.

Reviews.Title: “No A/C, no fan, don't go on summer”
Reviews.Author: RoxLima
Reviews.Content: Just came back from holidays. The location is really good ... but there are plenty of hotels around and actually most of the city is so well connected with buses and trams that chances are that you won't have any problem figuring out your way around. I thought that the price was good given that I've only needed a place to sleep. I reviewed the comments related to no A/C but thought it wouldn't be a problem, believe me, it is! sometimes I wanted to go back to the hotel to rest but just thinking in the sauna that was waiting there... even late at night was incredible hot, got a room in the ground floor and even with the window wide open it was awful. On top of that I was waken up around 5.00am b/c of the noise made by neighboors (think that were the next door restaurant staff doing some cleaning, etc) and the people at the front desk were not friendly/not helpful at all and only speak german. Almost forgot, there was a couple of days that I could notice they didn't clean the room at all, and when I've checked in I had to do some cleaning (to be on the safe side). One more thing: the matress is harder than sleepping in the bare floor (I always prefer firm matresses but this didn't qualify as such!) So, check your options.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: eleftheria26
Reviews.Content: Although I stayed in the hotel just for a night , my experience was great. Very easy to reach and find it from the airport. Very confortable and cozy rooms, with nice decoration. I had internet access in my room but as far as I understood not all the rooms have. The staff were really friendly and polite. The location was great, very central especially if u like shopping. Main sightseeing spots easy accesable and close by in the metro and train station. The breakfast was fine but it could be a bit richer.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: DeutschTraveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel three times. We love it! The double rooms are large, comfortable, immaculate, quiet. The baths are modern, plenty of hot water. The pretty little breakfast room is pleasant and the breakfast choices are more than adequate. We love the creaky old "birdcage" elevator -- once we figured out how to get the door open! The location, just off Ku'damm is perfect for shopping and access to transportation. The staff is friendly and helpful although we don't usually ask for much as we are familiar with the city. We did recommend the hotel to a colleague and she and her husband were also satisfied with the accommodations. Keep in mind that this is a European Hotel, not a Holiday Inn Express. Most of hte guests are Germans or other Europeans.

Reviews.Title: “Cute rooms in a safe area”
Reviews.Author: jmdahm
Reviews.Content: I stopped in Berlin at the tail end of a business trip in Germany. I don't usually travel by myself, so i wanted to make sure I was in a safe area and a nice hotel. It met both of those needs. The room was cute and clean. If you're staying in west berlin, then it was quite near the main shopping strip. The stores are open later here than in other parts of the city. The staff could have offered better advice about restaurants and attractions the area. Also, it was pretty much impossible to access the internet from my room. I would still recommend this hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Traveller11111111
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in Berlin so far given the great choice of good hotels. I am also quite picky when it comes to beds and rooms. The Savoy is an excellent choice in an excellent location. I loved the rooms, the upgrade (!) and the service, and I will come back again.

HotelInfo.Name: Savoy Am Kurfurstendamm Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Meinekestrasse 4, 10719 Berlin, Germany
